data.description: Introduction to information management and retrieval concepts.  The design and implementation of a relational database using a commercial DBMS.  Online information retrieval and manipulation.  Not acceptable for credit for Computer Science majors. This course will have additional fees.

data.subject: COP
data.name: Database Management
data.description: Logical aspects of databases including Relational, Entity-Relationship, and Object-Oriented data models, database design, SQL, relational algebra, tuple calculus, domain calculus, and physical database organization. This course will have additional fees.

data.subject: COP
data.name: Advanced DB Management
data.description: Design & management of enterprise systems; query optimization, transaction processing; concurrency techniques; web queries; XML interchanges; data warehousing, datamining; OLAP; NOSQL and big data. Prerequisite: COP 4703 or COP 4710

data.subject: COP
data.name: Web Applicatn Prog
data.description: Creating Web applications with user interfaces, databases, state management, user authentication, error handling, and web services. Prerequisite: CGS 4854

data.subject: COP
data.name: Compon Software Dev
data.description: Integrating, exchanging, and transforming XML data, building software from components, understanding security concepts, basic Web services.

data.subject: COP
data.name: Operating Systems
data.description: Operating systems design principles, algorithms and implementation techniques: process and memory management, disk and I/O systems, communications and security.

data.subject: COP
data.name: Principles of DBMS
data.description: Overview of Database Systems, Relational Model, Relational Algebra and Relational Calculus; SQL; Database Applications; Storage and Indexing; Query Evaluation; Transaction Management.  Selected database topics will also be discussed.

data.subject: COP
data.name: Coop Computer Sci
data.description: One semester of full-time work, or equivalent, in an outside organization, limited to students admitted to the CO-OP program.  A written report and supervision evaluation is required of each student.

data.subject: COT
data.name: Discrete Structures
data.description: Align mathematical and computational concepts by applying computing to propositional logic, sets, functions relations, induction, recursion, combinatorics, Boolean algebra, graph and trees. Prerequisites: MACXXXX and COPXXXX Corequisites: (COP2210 or COP2250 or EEL2880)

data.subject: COT
data.name: Logic For Comp Sci
data.description: An introduction to the logical concepts and computational aspects of propositional and predicate logic, as well as to concepts and techniques underlying logic programming, in particular, the computer language Prolog. This course will have additional fees.

data.subject: COT
data.name: Thry Computation I
data.description: Abstract models of computation; including finite automata, regular expressions, context-free grammars, pushdown automata, Turing machines. Decidability and undecidability of computational problems. Prerequisite: MAD 3512.

data.subject: COT
data.name: Intro to Algorithms
data.description: Design of efficient data structures and algorithms; analysis of algorithms and asymptotic time complexity; graph, string, and geometric algorithms; NP-completeness.

data.subject: COT
data.name: Formal Foundations Cyber
data.description: Formal models and methods for achieving rigorous security guarantees. Cryptographic indistinguishability properties, reduction proofs. Formal analyses of security APIs. Secure information flow. Prerequisite: CIS 5370.

data.subject: COT
data.name: Opt. Com. Thr. & Appl.
data.description: Optimization for CS students, including introduction to optimization algorithms, applications in CS, efficient computing, and real-world problems. Basic calculus and programming skills are needed. Prerequisites: MAC 2311 Calculus I or equivalent; MAS 3105 Linear Algebra or equivalent (instructor's permission is acceptable)

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Intro Comp Pol
data.description: Analysis of major theories of comparative politics including development, state building, institutions, patterns of political interaction and comparative elites. Focus on Latin America and the Third World.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Comparative Polit
data.description: Examines major theories and methods of comparative politics, focusing on divergent political systems (Democracy, Authoritarianism, Totalitarianism). Countries/regions studied vary with instructor.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Authoritarians and Democrats
data.description: Examines the collapse of democracy, rise of authoritarianism, the breakdown of authoritarian regimes, incipient processes of democracy and its challenges.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Politics Of W Europe
data.description: Studies of political systems of the major European countries on a comparative basis. Attention is focused on such factors as political party systems, the cabinet form of government, and EU politics.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: African Politics
data.description: Compares the politics of Sub-Saharan Africa, and the Republic of South Africa and addresses questions of economic development, the colonial legacy, and the impact of traditional social patterns.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Pol Latin America
data.description: This course analyzes the multiple structures, processes, and groups which are relevant to an understanding of Latin American political economy. Of special interest are the political impacts of land and wealth inequality and economic dependency. The dynamics of Latin American politics are considered, with an emphasis on the role of the military and the church. Alternate strategies for modernizing the region are considered.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Pol. Of Middle East
data.description: This course will focus on the social, cultural, and political aspects of the Middle East region. Through an understanding and an interweaving of these complex facets, a student should gain a foundation and background for comprehension of the contemporary conflict which pervades this mercurial region.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Pol Devlpmt Underdev
data.description: This course is an analysis of the causes of development and underdevelopment in Third and Fourth World countries. It includes an analysis of major theoretical approaches to understanding development problems, as well as an analysis of the roles of major national and non-national actors.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Political Vio & Revo
data.description: An examination of major historical instances and modern expressions of political violence; discussion of revolution from a comparative perspective. Attention will focus on the social origin and political determinants of such events.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Pol South America
data.description: A cross-national discussion of the political systems and cultures of the Latin American nations, with special emphasis on the larger countries. Attention is given to the role of the military and to the problem of violence. Designed to give the student an overview of the political life of the nations with whom we share this hemisphere.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Comparative Genocide
data.description: A comparative anaylsis of the pre-conditions and processes associated with major cases of 20th century genocide, including Armenia, Germany, Cambodia, Bosnia, and Rwanda.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Transition and Human Rights
data.description: Study of human rights in context of democratic transitions. Focus on democratic theory and role of international community. Case studies will illuminate post-Cold War transitions as models for future.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Comp Politics
data.description: A  foundation in the development of the field of comparative politics and in the major schools of thought that have molded perspectives on comparative political analysis.

data.subject: CPO
data.name: Topics In Comp Pols
data.description: A rigorous examination of a topic in comparative politics. Subject matter varies according to instructor. Topic will be announced in advance.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Forms and Practices
data.description: Analysis of the theoretical constructs underlying the various genres of imaginative writing, including practice in the forms.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Narrative Technique
data.description: Analysis of and exercises in the elements of fiction: point of view, conflict, characterization, tone. Students will do various short assignments and one short story. Reading of published fiction will also be required.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Poetic Techniques
data.description: Analysis of and exercises in poetic techniques. Students will write poems in which they employ one or more technical skills. Reading and discussion of published poems will be required.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Writing Fiction
data.description: An intermediate course in writing fiction. May be repeated.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Writing Poetry
data.description: An intermediate course in writing poetry. May be repeated.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Adv Fiction Wkshop
data.description: Practice in the techniques and analysis of fiction through the reading, discussion, and revision of student manuscripts in a workshop setting. May be repeated. Prerequisite: 9 hours undergraduate CRW course work.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Adv Poetry Wkshop
data.description: Practice in the techniques and analysis of poetry through the reading, discussion, and revision of student manuscripts in a workshop setting. May be repeated. Prerequisite: 9 hours undergraduate CRW course work.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Special Topics Crw
data.description: A course designed to give students an opportunity to pursue special studies in aspects of creative writing not otherwise offered. May be repeated.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Special Topics Crw
data.description: Gives students an opportunity to pursue special studies in aspects of creative writing not otherwise offered. May be repeated.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Adv Ind Study Crw
data.description: Development and completion of a graduate level independent project in creative writing undertaken with the consent of the instructor. Prerequisites: Graduate standing and permission of the instructor.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Teach Creative Wrt
data.description: The course will prepare graduate students (and teachers from secondary schools and community colleges) to teach introductory classes and workshops in Creative Writing. Students will observe and participate in the department's CRW 2001 courses.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Creative Thesis
data.description: Research and writing for the creative writing thesis. May be repeated.

data.subject: CRW
data.name: Creative Thesis Cont
data.description: Further guidance and direction for creative writing MFA candidates who have completed the two semester intensive sequence in CRW 6971. May be repeated.

data.subject: CTS
data.name: Fund of Cybersec
data.description: Don't get hacked, be safe, and protect your digital footprint. Actions taken can have a lasting impact in your personal, financial and professional life. Recognize and prevent threats.

data.subject: CTS
data.name: Unix Sys Admin
data.description: Techniques of Unix system administration: system configuration and management; user setup, management and accounting; software installation and configuration; network setup, configuration and management.

data.subject: CTS
data.name: Database Admin
data.description: Client-server architecture; planning, installation, server configuration; user management; performance optimization; backup, restoration; security configuration; replication management; administrative tasks.

data.subject: CTS
data.name: EnterpriseIT Troubleshoot
data.description: This course covers advanced topics in troubleshooting from the perspective of an infrastructure engineer focusing on diagnosing & resolving issues found in common application architectures patterns. Prerequisite: COP 4703 and (CNT 4403 or EEL 4806)

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Fluid Mechanics
data.description: A study of the properties of fluids and their behavior at rest and in motion. Continuity, momentum, and energy principles of fluid flow.

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Fluid Mechanics Lab
data.description: Application of fluid mechanics principles in the laboratory. Experiments in surface water, ground-water and pipe flow. Prerequisites:  CGN2420, MAP2302, and (EGN3321 or EGM3503)  Corequisite:  CWR3201

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Water Resources Eng.
data.description: Hydrologic and hydraulic engineering fundamentals and applications: water resources issues, hydrologic cycle and processes, measurements, hyetographs, hydrographs, probability and design, groundwater flow and well hydraulics.

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Hydraulic Engrg
data.description: Design and analysis applications to systems and facilities, such as open channels, culverts, storm water control, flood control, pumps, and hydroelectric power.

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Model Water Res Eng
data.description: Model applicationsin hydrology, hydraulics, hydrosystems engineering and environmental interconnections.

data.subject: CWR
data.name: Optimization Water Res.
data.description: This course presents the fundamentals of optimization techniques and their applications to various water resources engineering problems such as flood control and design of hydraulic structures. Prerequisite: CWR 3540 or permission of instructor

data.subject: CYP
data.name: Intro Commun Psy
data.description: An introduction to the issues and scope of Community Psychology. Students will be exposed to the development of Community Psychology as a growing discipline. Particular emphasis will be placed on the role of the community psychologist as an agent of social change.

data.subject: DAA
data.name: Tap Dance Techniques
data.description: Designed for students interested in learning the skills and techniques of tap dancing. May be repeated.

data.subject: DAA
data.name: Dance Composition I
data.description: Introduction course in dance composition. Improvisation, movement invention and basic choreographic forms are introduced and explored. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: DAN
data.name: Dance Appreciation
data.description: An overview of dance from a variety of cultural and traditional perspectives. Through film, lecture, and movement, this course explores the diverse ways in which we organize and interpret our life experience as human beings through dance.

data.subject: DAN
data.name: Independent Study
data.description: Individual study by students under the direction of a faculty member. Topics vary; they are usually selected on an individual basis.

data.subject: DAN
data.name: Research
data.description: Supervised individual investigation of special research projects. Credit will vary with the nature and scope of the project. May be repeated.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Human Growth Dev
data.description: An introductory study of the development of personality, intelligence, and motivation, from childhood to adulthood. Emphasis is on development of cognitive systems through social learning. The full life span of human growth and development will be considered.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Psy Infnt/Childhood
data.description: An introduction to human development focusing on infancy and childhood. Particular attention will be devoted to intellectual, personality, and social development. Consideration will be given to both theoretical and empirical perspectives.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Infant Knowledge
data.description: Provides a comprehensive review of current methods, theories, and findings in cognitive and perceptual development in the first year of life. Special emphasis on the bases of knowledge; object and event perception, memory, and imitation.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Psy Of Adolescence
data.description: An examination of psychological, sociological and biological factors contributing to the changes from childhood to adolescence and from adolescence to young adulthood.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Psy Of Adulthood
data.description: The transition from youth to middle age is studied. Focus is on changing roles in family, work, and societal settings, as these factors influence personality and other aspects of psychological function.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Psych Of Parenting
data.description: An intensive examination of the reciprocal influences of parents on the development of their children and of children on the adult development of their mothers and fathers.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Children's Learning
data.description: Learning in infancy and childhood, with particular emphasis on simple conditioning, discrimination shifts, mediation, transposition, observational, and concept learning. Prerequisite: Students enrolling in this course should have completed successfully at least one prior course in developmental psychology.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Social Development
data.description: A survey of facts and theories of human social emotional development and social learning in the early years of life.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Psychology Of Aging
data.description: An examination of the factors that contribute to the psychological profile characterizing old age. Biological and sociological components are considered, and their impact on perceptual, cognitive, and personality processes is analyzed.

data.subject: DEP
data.name: Theor Pers Dev Psy
data.description: The focus of this course is on the major paradigms, models, and theories that have been influential in developmental psychology, both historically and contemporaneously. Meta-theoretical issues, paradigmatic influences, and specific theories are considered. Prerequisites: Graduate standing or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Mgmt Dietary Systems
data.description: Survey of various types of institutional food service systems; management concepts in planning, implementing, and evaluating food service systems.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: App Mgmt Diet Sys
data.description: Application of principles of food service production and management including production, service, food sanitation and safety.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Clinical Nutrition
data.description: Study of the complex dietetic problems accompanying metabolic disorders. Determination of nutrient requirements based on pathophysiological conditions.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Cli Nutrition Lab
data.description: Application of nutrient requirements for the treatment of complex pathophysiological conditions.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Nutr Counseling
data.description: Nutrition counseling methods and communication skills for development of entry level competencies. Advanced standing in dietetics required.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Nutr Counseling Lab
data.description: Small group video recorded practice in instruction counseling communication skills.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Seminar Dietet/Nutr
data.description: Professional skills development for career effectiveness in today's job world; emphasis on speaking and writing related to contemporary nutrition issues.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Dietetics Research
data.description: Research methodology for planning, conducting and analyzing evidence based research in applied dietetics.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Comp Dietetic Exam
data.description: A comprehensive examination of the dietetics and nutrition curriculum.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Dietetic Adm and Mgt
data.description: Application of the principles, concepts, theories, and methodologies of administration and management to dietetic systems in healthcare and foodservice.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Pediatric Obesity
data.description: This course is designed to apply the latest tools and practice recommendations needed to educate and counsel in the area of childhood obesity and prevention. Prerequisites: HUN 6415 and HUN 6416.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Adv Tech Diet Prctse
data.description: Techniques and approaches in changing nutritional behavior, establishing private practice, providing dietetic services in various size institutions, hospitals, nursing homes, and in the community.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Adv Tech Diet Prctse
data.description: Individual practice in conducting interviews, planning nutritional care, changing nutritional behavior, and providing dietetic consultation. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Res II
data.description: This course will further expand student knowledge and skills in research in Dietetics and Nutrition primarily through the development of a research proposal. Prerequisite: DIE 6568.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Res I
data.description: Consideration of scientific methods and theoretical orientation as applied to research in dietetics. Special consideration given to various techniques of investigation, data collection, data organization, and interpretation. Prerequisites: STA 6166 or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Project Diet Nutr
data.description: Development and completion of a research project on a specific, important topic, question or need in the area of dietetics and nutrition.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Readings Dietet/Nutr
data.description: Individual advanced study in a comprehensive overview of dietetics and nutrition or in-depth advanced study of a specialty. Prerequisites: Permission of the instructor and advanced standing in graduate program.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Indiv Study Diet/Nut
data.description: Intensive individual investigation of a phase of dietetics. Emphasis on recent findings in dietetics and allied disciplines. Prerequisite: Permission of the Instructor.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Supervised Research
data.description: Continuation of thesis research under thesis advisor. Repeatable. Prerequisite: Completion of all other required course work.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Spec Topics In Diet
data.description: In-depth study of historical, epidemiological, prevention, and treatment aspects of topics related to dietetics. Prerequisites: Competence in topic covered, admission to graduate program.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Graduate Seminar
data.description: Presentations by researchers and doctoral students on studies, theories, applications; journal club presentations by students. Two semesters enrollment, M.S. students; three semesters Ph.D. students.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Adv Diet Prac I
data.description: Advanced practical application of knowledge and skills in a supervised practice setting.

data.subject: DIE
data.name: Ph.D. Dissertation
data.description: Research for doctoral dissertation. Prerequisite: Permission of Major Professor and Doctoral Candidacy.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Introduction to Digital Media
data.description: This course will develop and enhance students' understanding of the practical foundations for digital communication, including an overview of the historical development of digital communication.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Web Production
data.description: This course provides a strong foundation in Web production for media professionals, including HTML, CSS, responsive design, Javascript, basic product research and user testing. Prerequisites: MMC 3003, RTV 3531, 2.85 cumulative GPA.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Social Media
data.description: This course is an introduction to social media platforms, audiences and content creation strategies. Students will use metrics to create and assess content for diverse audiences. Prerequisite: MMC 3003 and 2.85 cumulative GPA or admission to Digital Communication and Media Certificate

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Interactive Visualization
data.description: This course provides a foundation in data analysis and data visualization for media professionals. Students learn to gather, process, analyze and visualize data in combination with storytelling. Prerequisites: MMC 3003, (DIG 3110 or JOU 3117), 2.85 cumulative GPA.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Podcasting & Social Media
data.description: The emphasis of this course is on the successful creation of podcasts, Instagram Stories and social media content using photos, graphics, sound, video, and animation. Prerequisite: RTV 3531

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Multimedia Production 2
data.description: This is a project-based course that adds to the student's knowledge of multimedia production. There will be and emphasis on video production and streaming, including studio production projects. Prerequisites:  MMC 3003, MMC 3123, RTV 3531, 2.85 cumulative GPA.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Motion Graphics
data.description: Motion Graphics for Digital Media introduces the theories, techniques, and practices of motion graphics and the integration of design, photo imaging for media professionals. Prerequisites: RTV 3531 and VIC 3400

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Advanced Multimedia Production
data.description: This capstone course covers advanced techniques associated with interactive media production, including design, digital storytelling, usability theory, and current best practices. Prerequisites: MMC 3003, MMC 3123, (RTV 4101 or MMC4302 or DIG 3146), (RTV 3511 or MMC 4631 or DIG 3253), RTV 3531, DIG 4293, (DIG 3181 or DIG 3253), (DIG 4800 or RTV 4101), (DIG 3110 or RTV 3007), (DIG 4394 or MMC4631 or RTV3007), 2.85 cumulative GPA

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Digital Theories
data.description: This course explores the emerging field of digital media theories through a variety of academic and professional perspectives including technology studies, critical media, and cultural studies.

data.subject: DIG
data.name: Digital Media Internship
data.description: The internship is specifically designed to enhance the learning experience through in-depth reflection and critical analysis of the work environment.Prerequisites:  MMC3003, MMC3303, MMC3123, IDS3309, MMC4200, VIC3400, RTV3531, DIG3001, and 2.85 cumulative GPA

data.subject: DSC
data.name: Terrorism and Homeland Secu
data.description: This course examines issues of terrorism and homeland security.

data.subject: DSC
data.name: Terrorism and Homeland Sec
data.description: This course focuses on the domestic and international threats of terrorism and the basic security issues that surround terrorism today.

data.subject: EAB
data.name: Behavior Analysis
data.description: An introduction to and survey of the principles, methods, theories, and applications of the experimental analysis of behavior.

data.subject: EAB
data.name: Principles of ABA
data.description: Studies different approaches to the modification of problem behavior, through the application of learning principles and theories.

data.subject: EAB
data.name: ABA Assess & Intervention
data.description: Covers the use of behavior analysis to treat childhood behavior problems commonly associated with disorders such as autism spectrum, attention deficit, anxiety, phobia and obesity. Prerequisite:  EAB3002 Corequisite: EAB 3794

data.subject: EAB
data.name: Senior Seminar in ABA
data.description: Students complete an advance project in applied behavior analysis. Includes career planning and certification exam preparation. Prerequisite: PSY 3213 or PSY 3215, and EAB 4764.

data.subject: EAB
data.name: Single Case Methods
data.description: Intensive study of designs, strategies, and methods of single-case behavioral research.

data.subject: EAS
data.name: Intro Flight Mech
data.description: An introductory level course on the fundamentals of aero-space engineering with emphasis on aerodynamics and airplane performance.

data.subject: EAS
data.name: Aerodynamics and Flight Mechan
data.description: Fundamentals of aerodynamics, definition of aerodynamic shapes, analysis of aerodynamic forces, airplane performance, and flight stability and control. Prerequisites: EGN 3321, EML 3126, EGN 3343.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Principles Macroeco
data.description: Introduction to economic analysis of the overall economy: national income accounting, unemployment, inflation, monetary and fiscal policies, budget deficits and debt, long-run growth.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Principles Microeco
data.description: Introduction to economic analysis of individual units- households and firms. Operation of markets; supply and demand analysis.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Intermed Microecon
data.description: Analysis of markets, theory of firm, demand and production theories, general equilibrium, and welfare economics.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Intermed Macroecon
data.description: Analysis of the aggregate economy in the long-run (full employment, economic growth, productivity) and the short-run (unemployment, business cycles); economic policy for short-run stability and long-run growth (monetary and fiscal policies, budget deficit, inflation, and debt); balance of payments and exchange rate.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Money & Banking
data.description: Elements of monetary theory; relationships between money, prices, production, and employment; factors determining money supply; history and principles of banking, with special references to the United States.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Meas & Analy Eco Act
data.description: Covers statistical methods as applied in economics. Topics include estimation and hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, and single and multiple regression models. Satisfies requirement in computer literacy.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Co-Op Ed In Eco
data.description: A student majoring in Economics may spend one or two semesters fully employed in industry or government in a capacity relating to the major. Does not count as economics elective toward economics major.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Econometrics
data.description: Application of statistics and economic theory to formulating, estimating, and drawing inferences about relationships among economic variables. Coverage includes linear regression model, heteroscedasticity, serial correlation, multicollinearity, and simultaneous equations.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Quantitative Economics
data.description: An introduction to contemporary computational methods and numerical analysis in economics and econometrics using a modern structured programming language. Prerequisite: ECO 3101, ECO 3202, ECO 3410, ECO 4421

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Intro Public Finance
data.description: Describes the way resources are allocated in a market economy and cases where markets fail. Analyzes government expenditure policy, principles of taxation, and the various taxes in use today.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: World Economy
data.description: A broad overview of the international economy in historical perspective. Topics: economic demography, trade flows, capital movements, diffusion of technology, the emergence of transnational institutions. The student obtains a conception of how economic interdependence has developed.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Int Trade Theory
data.description: Causes and consequences of international trade; effects of tariffs and quotas; strategic trade and industrial policies; political economy of protectionism; international economic integration; factor movements; and multinational firms.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Intl Macroeconomics
data.description: Analysis of output, inflation, business cycles and economic policy in open economy settings; exchange rate regimes (fixed versus flexible exchange rate); fiscal, monetary, and exchange rate policies.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Undergrad Seminar
data.description: Small class in which students will discuss readings, write research paper, and defend research and ideas orally.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Topics In Theory
data.description: Study of a particular topic or a selected number of topics in economics theory not otherwise offered in the curriculum.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Special Topics
data.description: A course designed to give students a particular topic or a limited number of topics not otherwise offered in the curriculum. May be repeated for credit with permission of Department. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Co-Op Ed In Eco
data.description: A student majoring in economics may spend one or two semesters fully employed in industry or government in a capacity relating to the major. Does not count as economics elective toward economics major.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: The World Economy
data.description: Designed to give an overview of the crucial issues in the world economy. The course covers trade, capital, labor, and technology flows; transnational economic organizations; current economic crisis; global economic interdependence; and the nature and characteristics of international economic order. Required for MIB Program.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Micro Theory I
data.description: Game theory. Analysis of static and dynamic games of complete and incomplete information. Introduction to contracts and mechanism design.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Macro Theory I
data.description: Analysis of macroeconomic models of income determination and the price level, microeconomic foundations of macro-behavior, macroeconometric models, and basic open economy macroeconomics. Prerequisites: ECO 3203, ECO 4410, or equivalents; Calculus I; Calculus II recommended.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Econometrics Metds I
data.description: Formulation, estimation, evaluation of econometric models. Includes: review probability theory, OLS, properties of estimators, asymptotics, hypothesis tests, violations of classical assumptions, IV. Prerequisites: MAS 3105, ECO 7405.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Econometrics III
data.description: Continuation of ECO 7425. Topics include multivariate models, times series models, panel data models, test procedures and model selection.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: International Trade
data.description: Positive and normative aspects of international trade. Theories of comparative advantage, commercial policy, trade and income distribution. Prerequisites: Advanced Microeconomic Theory; Calculus.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: International Money
data.description: Theory of international monetary equilibrium. Problems of international payments and exchange rate control; their effect on international monetary problems. Analysis of short and long term monetary flows and macroeconomic adjustment. Prerequisites: Advanced Macroeconomics and Calculus.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Adv Workshop
data.description: Enables students to attend advanced workshop presentations and to present the results of their own research. Prerequisite: Completion of field examination requirements.

data.subject: ECO
data.name: Ph.D. Dissertation
data.description: To be taken every semester for research on, and writing of Ph.D. dissertation by candidates for the Ph.D. Prerequisite: Permission of Major Professor and Doctoral Candidacy.

data.subject: ECP
data.name: Women, Men, Work
data.description: Analyzes the performance of women in comparison to men in the US labor market.

data.subject: ECP
data.name: Intro To Envir Econ
data.description: Economic principles applied to environmental problems. Relationship of market and non-market forces to environmental quality. Development of tools for policy analysis.

data.subject: ECP
data.name: Law And Economics
data.description: The relationship of economic principles to law and the use of economic analysis to the study of legal problems. Topics include: property rights and contracts, and economic analysis of legal decision making.

data.subject: ECP
data.name: Women&Economy
data.description: Study of women and the economy, paying attention to family, work, and pay. Prerequisite: ECO 2023

data.subject: ECP
data.name: Industrial Org
data.description: Theory of the firm, market structure; business strategies and conduct. Topics include information and advertising, product durability, technical change, antitrust and trade policies, and regulation.

data.subject: ECS
data.name: Intro To Econ Develo
data.description: Structural and institutional determinants of economic development; economic analysis and policy formation. Topics include theories of economic development, economic growth, income distribution, rural-urban migration, industry and agriculture, unemployment, education, international trade, economic reform, and the environment.

data.subject: ECS
data.name: Women Econ Devel
data.description: Analysis of problems facing women in developing countries, focusing on gender and cultural issues and their relationships to economic development.

data.subject: ECS
data.name: Pol Eco Of So Americ
data.description: An introduction to the political economy of the South American countries, with emphasis on the opening of the region's economies, privatization and deregulation, debt crisis, foreign investment, poverty, income distribution, human resources, and regional trade agreements.

data.subject: ECT
data.name: Found Voc Ed
data.description: History of vocational legislation, principles and practices on the national, state, and local levels.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Communicatn Ed Lead
data.description: This course consists of analysis of principles, processes, and techniques of effective communication, public relations in educational leadership, and school-community relations.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Sch Personnel Admin
data.description: This course provides the knowledge and skills essential for exercising effective leadership in school personnel recruitment, selection, orientation, assessment, and professional development.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: School Finance
data.description: This course describes and analyzes current and emerging school finance plans; the influence of the courts and federal and state legislation on those plans; the Florida Education Finance Plan; and the budget responsibilities of the school principal.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Instruc Leadership
data.description: This course focuses on the role of instructional leadership in schools and the role of school administrators in promoting and sustaining instructional leadership.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Dir Stud Ed Ldrship
data.description: This course is for advanced graduate students wishing to engage in independent study under the direction of a faculty member. Prerequisites: Admission to master's program and permission of instructor.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Seminar Ed Ldrshp
data.description: This course is a review of selected concepts and competencies in the field of educational leadership.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Admin Internship
data.description: This course will provide supervised field experience appropriate to the student's interests and professional goals.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Theories Ed Admin
data.description: This course is an examination of theoretical constructs and models related to the organization and administration of educational institutions. Prerequisite: Admission to doctoral program. Doctoral students only.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Dir Stud Ed Ad/Supv
data.description: This course is for advanced graduate students wishing to engage in independent study under the direction of a faculty member. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EDA
data.name: Ed.D. Dissertation
data.description: This course consists of research for doctoral dissertation. Prerequisite: Permission of major professor and doctoral candidacy.

data.subject: EDE
data.name: Student Teaching
data.description: Culminating internship experience for Elementary Education majors. Students will assume all responsibilities in classroom; all FEAP and Eleme Ed competencies learned in program will be demonstrated.

data.subject: EDE
data.name: Cur Des Child Ed
data.description: Required in masters programs in elementary education. A study of curriculum theory, research, construction and evaluation related to elementary schools.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Intro To Education
data.description: Introductory survey course designed to review education and teaching in America from multiple perspectives. Required of lower division education majors. Field experience required.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Tching Diverse Pop
data.description: Introductory course designed to present the theories and realities of teaching diverse populations. Field experience required.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Classrm Management
data.description: This course is designed to provide teachers with the understanding, skills, and dispositions for successful classroom management.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Meas Eval Classroom
data.description: Basic concepts in educational measurement, utilizing measurement in instruction, construction of teacher-made tests and other classroom assessments, portfolio and performance assessment, interpretation of standardized test scores.  Required in all Teacher Ed Programs.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Education In History
data.description: An examination of the concepts of childhood, and process of social initiation in differing historical America contexts. This course examines the transformation of the American public school system as it reflects the social, political and economic character of the development of the nation from 1620 to the present. Students will read commentaries and primary sources and explore and consider the relationships between education and national policies.  Satisfies the Societies and Identities requirement of the University Core Curriculum.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Cult & Soc Found Ed
data.description: Examines the cultural and social realities of teaching and learning in the U.S. Questions of class, race, ethnicity, gender and language are discussed in relation to effective school, teacher, and student performance.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Classrm Management
data.description: Provides teachers' understandings, skills, and dispositions for successful classroom management.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Foundations Ed Res
data.description: Competencies required for critical understanding, evaluation, and use of published educational research: Understanding quantitative and qualitative methods; sampling; measurement; data collection and analysis; and inference process.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Edu Psy: Appl Found
data.description: An intermediate course designed to apply theories and principles of learning and development to teaching and student learning in career areas related to education. Challenges of diversity and teacher effectiveness are emphasized.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Int Dat Anly Ed Res
data.description: This foundational course in research provides a broad overview of statistical concepts and analysis to promote a student's research ability in social science and educational settings.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Qual Found E Res
data.description: Methods and procedures of qualitative research in education: Philosophical issues, conceptualizing research questions, choosing appropriate research designs, collecting data, manual and computerized data analysis, and drawing inferences.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Ed Research Method
data.description: This course is designed to provide doctoral students with an in-depth analysis of the methods and procedures of research in education. Topics will include conceptualizing educational research, writing research proposals, constructing measurement instruments, collecting and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data, and drawing inferences.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Advance Anly Ed Res
data.description: This is the second of a two-semester in quantitative data analysis. It provides the competencies required for data analysis in complex educational research designs.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Soc Phil Hist Found
data.description: This course is required of students seeking a regular Masters degree in Education. It will assist students in examining and explaining the differing social context of schooling, the diverse value orientation represented in formal and informal education and the major historical forces shaping schooling in America.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Sel Top Int Dev Ed
data.description: This course is dedicated to the study of contemporary problems and issues in the fields of educational policy, planning, management, implementation, and research in developing societies.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Cont Iss Urb Ed
data.description: This course examines the state of urban education and contemporary urban life in America. Prerequisite: Admission to Masters program.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Dir Stud Intl Devel
data.description: This course is a specialized intensive study in areas of interest to International Development Education majors. Prerequisite: Approval of program advisor and instructor.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: SEM Ed Res
data.description: The course focuses on conceptual understanding of covariance structure models and practical experiences of conducting a research project using structural equation models in educational fields. Prerequisites: EDF 6472, EDF 6486, or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Adv Qual Res
data.description: Advanced design, data collection, and data analysis issues in qualitative research, applied data analysis using text analysis computer programs, making inferences, and effective dissemination of the results. Prerequisite: EDF 6475 or equivalent.

data.subject: EDF
data.name: Spec Top in Qual Res
data.description: This course is dedicated to the study of contemporary issues in qualitative and interpretive inquires.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: FTCE - GK Prep
data.description: A review of basic skills and competencies necessary to pass the Florida Teacher Certification GK Exam. Required if student has not passed GK within 72 credits. Education Majors Only; Lab Fee.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Instructional Decisions
data.description: Includes instructional decisions, classroom management, assessment and ethics, supportive of students' thinking and individual differences.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Independ Study Education
data.description: Designed to provide an opportunity to gain or enhance knowledge, to research a specific area, issues and trends, and/or the delivery of education in K-12 settings. Prerequisite: Department consent is required.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Inst. Strat & Class Mgmt
data.description: Includes instructional decisions, classroom management, assessment, and ethics that are supportive of all students' thinking and individual differences. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Fun of Learning
data.description: Designed to help educators use learning styles information to change instruction and improve student achievement.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Independ Resrch Education
data.description: Designed to provide an opportunity to enhance their educational research knowledge, to research a specific area, issues and trends, and/or the delivery of education in K-12 settings. Prerequisite: Department consent is required.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Supvd Fld Exp
data.description: Students are provided an opportunity to perform supervisory duties appropriate to the students' professional goals. Only advanced graduate students are permitted to enroll.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Thesis in C&I
data.description: An individually supervised research project demonstrating the application of analytical, conceptual and technical skill to a specific curriculum and instruction problem.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Advanced Research Teach
data.description: This course supports advanced research for doctoral students before their admission to a candidacy. It is designed for students in a Teaching & Learning doctoral program. It is not appropriate for students who have been admitted to candidacy.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Inst: Theo And Res
data.description: Theories of instruction and research in the learning process, creativity, the thought process, human relations and group dynamics and other fields related to the development of instructional theory and practice.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Adv Topics Curr Stud
data.description: Advanced study of current topics and research issues in curriculum studies. May be repeated.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Ed Policy
data.description: Contextualizes education policy in broader political, historical, ideological, and power discourses. Examines relevant policy case studies and strategies for policy advocacy.

data.subject: EDG
data.name: Ed.D. Dissertation
data.description: Original contribution to knowledge in major field. Prerequisite: Permission of Major Professor and Doctoral Candidacy.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Found Acad Advising
data.description: This course provides overview of developmental advising theories and current research on academic advising, cultural issues related to advising, and delivery systems for advising.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: College Stdnt Life
data.description: This course examines college students in the US from a socio-cultural perspective. Compares student life across historical contexts, various student types, and current issues related to student development.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Leadership In He
data.description: This course consists of an analysis and comparison of leadership theories, followership, leadership and management, ethics of leadership, and power and gender issues in higher education.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Acc Choice Higher Ed
data.description: This course examines who goes to college, how they choose, how they pay. Issues include college choice models, types of institutions, equality of access to college, financial aid, rankings, and affirmative action.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: History of Higher Ed
data.description: This course examines the history of American higher education

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Legal Issues HED Admin
data.description: This course offers a survey of legal issues of interest to practitioners in the field of higher education, including student rights, employment rights, due process, free speech, tort liability.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Org & Admin Stu Aff
data.description: This course is an exploration of organizational and administrative issues in Student Affairs including relationship to other executive areas, interrelationship of units, research, leadership and case studies.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Dir Stud Higher Ed
data.description: Specialized intensive study in higher education and/or community college is in areas of interest to the student and is subject to approval of program advisor. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Practicum HEA
data.description: Supervised practice in Higher Education offices/agencies to gain understanding of office/agency functions and role(s) of employees.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Class Gender Race High Ed
data.description: Examines historical and contemporary interrelationships of hegemony, domination, and power undergirding sociocultural viewpoints, institutional forces, and policy discourses in higher education.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Spec Res Topics High Ed
data.description: This doctoral seminar is devoted to the in-depth treatment of selected theories and research topics in the field of higher education.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Doctoral Candidacy Exam
data.description: Prerequisite: Permission of Major Professor.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Ph.D. Dissertation
data.description: This course consists of research for doctoral dissertation. Prerequisites: Permission of Major Professor. Course may be repeated as needed.

data.subject: EDH
data.name: Dissertation Proposal Sem
data.description: This course is a defense of the dissertation proposal. Instructor consent required. Prerequisite: Major Professor Approval.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Educational Psychol
data.description: Application of principles for understanding individual differences, learning, adjustment, classroom environments, and assessment to instructional and educational issues. Challenges of diversity and teacher effectiveness are addressed. Field experience required.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Child Devp
data.description: Examination of child growth and development from conception to age of 8.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Soc Emotional Devp
data.description: Personality, social and emotional development in early childhood.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Assess and Eval Child
data.description: Intellectual, emotional and personality assessment of young children.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Edu Psy: Princ & App
data.description: Theories, empirical bases and principles of development and individual differences, learning environments, and assessment applied to teaching at all educational levels. Challenges of diversity are emphasized. Required of Modified Masters programs.

data.subject: EDP
data.name: Behav Resch & Eval
data.description: Design and analysis of observational and behavioral studies in education. Includes single subject research studies, structured observation systems, and behavioral interventions.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Issues In Eec
data.description: Introduces issues related to schooling of children age three through grade 3.  This course has a field component. Students should apply to Office of Clinical Experiences of SOE to be placed in a school.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Art in Early Child
data.description: This course introduces the early childhood educator to the principles of art and aesthetics and shows how they are essential to making early learning meaningful and engaging.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Play and Soc Competence
data.description: To examine the role of play behaviors as they relate to social competence and academic development in the early years.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Fam Lit Young Child
data.description: This course focuses on involving parents of young children in the development of early literacy skills from local, national, and international perspectives. When parents begin to speak early to their children, read to them, and create literacy rich environment, children develop better literacy.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Sp Needs Ch & Fam
data.description: Focus on understanding family problems, children's behavior and intervention methods.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Com, Fam Young Child
data.description: This course will focus on the varying cultural contexts of  young children and the influences these environmental elements have on child development.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Assessing Young Children
data.description: This course is designed to expose students to the methods and instruments used to assess all young children in the early childhood years of life and to use this data to differentiate instruction.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Collab Appr Self Reg Emp
data.description: This course explores various frameworks for understanding typical and challenging behaviors in young children, key factors contributing to these behaviors and methods to create healthy relationships.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Early Child Ed Prog
data.description: Philosophy and theories of early childhood education programs; physical, emotional, social and cognitive development. Provides strategies for working with parents and evaluating programs. This course has a field component. Students should apply to Office of Clinical Experiences Office of SOE to be placed in a school.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Int Math and SCE EEC
data.description: This course prepares pre-service teachers to understand developmentally appropriate practices in Math and Science for young children and applying them to real-world integrated settings.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Student Teaching
data.description: Required of undergraduate early childhood majors as culmination of program. Provides experience in a prekindergarten, kindergarten or in the primary grades in an elementary school where student assumes all teaching responsibilities for a minimum of ten weeks.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Dir Stud Child Ed
data.description: Available to undergraduate and graduate students studying early childhood education. Provides for individual investigation in the area of early childhood education. Permission of the instructor required.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Ed Prog For Young Ch
data.description: Required in masters program in early childhood education. Programs developed for young children; curriculum trends based on contemporary psychological, educational, and sociological research.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Research Child Ed
data.description: Elective in masters program in early childhood education. Required for students in doctoral program. Research in early childhood education and the paradigms associated with this research.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Sem Ear Child Ed
data.description: Elective in masters program in early childhood education. Required for students in doctoral program. Advanced study of critical issues and problems in preschool and early childhood education.

data.subject: EEC
data.name: Sup Field Exp Ear Ch
data.description: Available to graduate early childhood education majors. Provides field work in educational institutions and organizations involved in childcare and early childhood education. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Electronics I & Lab
data.description:
Introductory course dealing with basic electronic devices such as diodes, BJTs,
FETs, Op-Amps, and their circuit applications. Hands on Lab with weekly activities
are included. Prerequisite: EEL 3110C

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Solid State Devices
data.description: Introduction to the physics of semiconductors; charge carrier statistics and charge transport in crystalline solids. Basic operations of solid state devices including p-n junction diode, the bipolar junction transistor and field effect transistors.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Electronics II and Lab
data.description:
Second course in electronics with emphasis on equivalent circuit representation and
analysis of electronic analog circuits and systems, their frequency response and
behavior under feedback control. Hands on Lab with weekly activities are included. Prerequisite: EEE 3303C.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: MEMS I
data.description: This course will give the students an introduction to MEMS-based microsystems with an emphasis on design and analysis of interdisciplinary systems at microscale.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Intro To Dsp
data.description: Modeling of DSP systems, Z transform, Algorithms for convolution, correlation functions, DFT, and FFT computation. Digital filters design, and engineering applications.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: IoT-Sec-Intro
data.description: In this class, the students will learn the introductory topics related to the security of loT by gaining hands-on experience on real loT devices. This class involves significant programming. Prerequisites: EEL 2880 or COP 2210 or COP 2250 or equivalent

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Intro Mobile Forensics
data.description: The course covers the theoretical and practical aspects of Mobile device forensics focusing on the identification, preservation, collection, analysis, and reporting techniques and tools. Prerequisite: EEL 4802

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Sig Det Theory
data.description: This course thoroughly investigates the fundamentals of modern signal detection theory. The topics to be covered include: Deterministic signals, Random signals, Statistical decision theory. Prerequisites: EEE 5543 or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Random Signal Princ
data.description: Noise, random processes, correlation, spectral analysis in the analysis and design of communication systems. Optimization techniques; minimum mean square error. Prerequisite: EEL 3514.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Adv-Security of IoT-CPS
data.description: In this project-based class, the students will gain advanced hands-on training in the security of Internet-of-Things (IoT) and Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) areas. Prerequisites: Programming coursework or any CS oriented courses (e.g. COPXXXX) or any embedded coursework or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Adv Elec Sys II
data.description: Study of linear properties of electronic systems and design of fault tolerant systems using A/D and D/A and control algorithms.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Semi Cond. Dev Theor
data.description: Device physics and modeling of GaAs FETS. GaAs analog and digital integrated circuits. Modulation doped field effect transistors. Heterojunction bipolar transistor theory.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Electronic Prop Mat
data.description: Properties of materials from which electronic components and structures are fabricated; electrical conduction in metals, semiconductors and insulators; thermal; magnetic; optical.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Adv Quantum Computers
data.description: This course provides advanced principles of quantum computers and quantum information systems with in-depth analysis and state of the art physical implementations.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Microsystems and MEMS
data.description: This course will give students an introduction with an emphasis on design and analysis of fundamentals of electrochemical sensing and integration into microfluidic systems. Prerequisites: EEL 3396 or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEE
data.name: Adv Embed Sys & IoT
data.description: This course will provide hand-on experience on the hardware design and implementation of a typical loT system/device using Eagle/Autodesk PCB design software. Prerequisite: EEL 3110 (Circuits Analysis) and EEL 3110 (Circuits Lab) or permission from instructor (No hardware design experience is required)

data.subject: EEL
data.name: C Prog Emb Sys
data.description: Engineering problem solving process, overview of a generalized computing system, software development, real-life engineering applications, computational implications.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Circuit Analysis and Lab
data.description:
Introductory circuit analysis dealing with DC, AC, and transient electrical circuit
analysis and the general excitation of circuits using the Laplace transform. Hands on Lab with weekly activities are included. Prerequisite: MAC 2312 or MAC 2282, PHY 2049, (EGN 1002 or EGS 1006) Corequisite: MAP 2302, and for EE or CpE Engineering students, EEL 2880

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro to Linear Systems
data.description: Introductory course on linear systems, deals with the use of linear algebra to analyze resistive and dynamic electric circuits.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Signals And Systems
data.description: Use of Fourier analysis in electrical and electronic systems. Introduction to probability theory, linear algebra and complex variables. Prerequisite: EEL 3120 or BME 2740 for BME students Corequisite: MAP2302

data.subject: EEL
data.name: C++ Prog Emb Sys
data.description: Object-oriented programming in C++ with emphasis on evaluation of alternative program design strategies. Class design, recursion, linked and dynamically allocated structures. This class will also include data structure concepts and applications.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro to Autonomous Sys
data.description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the components of autonomous systems and expose the students to the concept of autonomous systems from the perspective of autonomous mobile robotic. Prerequisite: EEL 2880

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Logic Design I
data.description: Boolean Algebra. Binary number systems. Combinational logic design using SSI, MSI and LSI. Sequential logic design.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Logic Design I Lab
data.description: Laboratory experiments, using gates, combinational networks, SSI, MSI, LSI. Sequential logic design.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Elec Des In Bldg I
data.description: Application of electrical codes and regulations. Design of loads, circuits, surge protectors, feeders, panels, and breakers.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Bus Plan Develop
data.description: This course is designed to help students develop an effective implementation plan for a new business venture. Prerequisite: EEL 4933

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro to Bus. Decisions
data.description: Fundamental concepts of industrial financial decisions, financial planning and analysis tools, justification for industrial capital investments, and intermediate and long-term financing options. Prerequisite: EGN 3613

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Power Systems I
data.description: Introductory course to power systems components; transformers, induction machines, synchronous machines, direct current machines, and special machines.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Energy Convrg Lab
data.description: Operation, testing, and applications of energy conversion machines including AC and DC motors and generators. Experiments on magnetic circuits and transformers.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Power Systems II
data.description: Transmission line models, the bus admittance matrix, load flow studies and solution techniques, economic dispatch with and without losses, computer applications related to power system operations.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Fields & Waves
data.description: Electric and magnetic fields. The relation between field and circuit theory: waves and wave polarization, reflection, refraction, and diffraction. Electromagnetic effects in high-speed digital systems.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro RF Circuit Design
data.description: Basic EM theory, transmission lines, guided EM propagation, microwave circuits, impedance matching, passive components, and filters. Full-wave simulation software will be used.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv Comm Systems
data.description: Advanced senior level course designed for those students who desire to enhance their engineering knowledge in communication systems. State-of-the-art techniques in FM, digital communication, phase locked loops, noise treatment, threshold improvement, etc. Prerequisite: EEL 3135 or permission of the instructor

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Control Systems II
data.description: Design by Root-Locus, Bode plot, and Guillin-Truxal approach; characteristics of some typical industrial controllers and sensors. Computer simulation and other modern topics are included.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Indus Control Systems
data.description: To learn the characteristics and the selection of hardware used in industrial control systems design. Various measurement devices, transducers, actuators used in control systems will be studied.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Computer Design
data.description: Computer architecture, arithmetic units, RAM, DRAM, ROM, disk, CPU, memory systems, data, input/output devices. Distributed and centralized control.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Programming Embedded Systms
data.description: Embedded Systems implementation using programming of synchronous state machines to capture behavior of time-oriented systems for running on microcontrollers.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Embedded System
data.description: Principles of embedded computing systems: architecture, hardware/software components, interfacing, hardware/software co-design, and communication issues.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: RISC
data.description: Design of interfacing schemes of RISC processors, and state-of-the-art hardware and software features of advanced RISC processor families.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Microcomputers II Lab
data.description: Hands-on design experience with microprocessor systems and applications using Electronic Design Automation tools.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro to Digi Forensics
data.description: The fundamentals of the computer and network forensics and media exploitation techniques and introduces students to computer forensic software and hardware tools. Prerequisites:  EEL 2880 or equivalent or CNT 4403 or permission of the instructor

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro Malware Reverse Eng
data.description: This course familiarize the student with the practice of performing reverse engineering on suspicious files and firmware present on various devices (computer to DVD player) and understand its impact. Prerequisites:  EEL 2880 or equivalent or CNT 4403 or permission of the instructor

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Ethical Hacking
data.description: This course will give individuals an exposure to latest hacking tools and techniques to understand the anatomy of computer attacks and teach them the countermeasures to protect their valuable data.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Senior Design I
data.description: Professional ethics, oral communications, project feasibility study, proposal writing, system design methodology, human factors, intellectual property, liability and schedules.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Senior Design II
data.description: Design of a complete EE or CpE system including use of design methodology, formulation, specifications, alternative solutions, feasibility, economic, reliability, safety ethics, and social impact.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Sp Top Elec Eng
data.description: Special topics in electrical engineering not covered in other courses. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Eng Entrepreneurship
data.description: Lectures, case studies, and seminars. Active student participation. Course material is augmented through seminars given by engineers, business people, and specialists, based on their own experiences.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Co-Op Work Exp
data.description: Practical Co-op engineering work under approved industrial supervision.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv. Sys. Theory
data.description: State-space representations for continuous and discrete-time systems, controllability and observability, pole-zero allocation, Lyapunov stability theorem, state observers.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: RF Circuit Design
data.description: Transmission lines, guided EM propagation, microwave circuits, resonators, impedance matching, passive components, thin-film circuits, filters, two-port networks, measurements, advanced simulations. Prerequisites: EEL 3135 and EEL 3110.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Dig Comm Sys II
data.description: This course will consider more important aspects of digital communication systems such as matched filters, digital base and modulation, multiplexing, carrier digital modulation and error correction coding. Prerequisites: EEL 5500 or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Auto Sys and Controls
data.description: This course provides an in-depth discussion to the fundamental components of autonomous system and controls. In particular, the course will allow the students to master the building blocks

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv Microproc Sys
data.description: Interfacing of various microprocessors together. Concepts of master-slave systems, virtual memory and I/O control techniques. Digital system evaluation and optimization. Prerequisites: EEL 4746 or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv Spec Topics
data.description: A course designed to give groups of students an opportunity to pursue special studies in an advanced topic of Electrical Engineering not otherwise offered. Prerequisite: Consent of instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Grad ECE Internship
data.description: Graduate students acquire practical experience through supervised internship in industry. The student prepares an internship proposal, and the work performed is documented in a report and presented.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Electric Power Qual
data.description: Modeling of networks under non-sinusodial conditions, loads which may cause power quality problems, analysis of harmonics, flickers, impulses, standards, power quality improvement methods.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Pow Sys Eco-Mark
data.description: This is a graduate-level course which covers the basic economics principles underpinning the design, operation, and planning of modern power systems in a competitive environment. Prerequisite: EEL 4213 or equivalent.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: ISGA
data.description: This course covers the basic fundamentals of smart grid. It provides the working definition of the functions, design criteria, tools, techniques, and technology needed for building smart grid. Prerequisite: EEL 4213 or equivalent.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Advanced VLSI Design
data.description: Advanced design and development of Very Large Scale Integrated Circuit (VLSI) Micro Chip Structures. Mirco Chip routing and thermal optimizations will be emphasized for implementing VLSI units.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Power Aware Comp
data.description: The power/thermal challenges in computing system design; source of the power dissipation and power/thermal modeling; power/thermal aware design techniques at different design abstraction levels. Prerequisites: EEL 4709C or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv In Neural Nets
data.description: Latest concepts in artificial neural networks research and newly developed applications. Implementation, convergence in learning algorithms, accuracy refinement, and optimal structure of neural networks. Engineering applications. Prerequisite: EEL 5813

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Computer Vision
data.description: Image formation and image properties, Radiance and irradiance, introduction to Brain Topography, Color Vision, visual machinery of the brain, statistical pattern classification and decision functions, the eigensystem and its computational aspects, stereo vision, motion vision, size and orientation independence. Prerequisite: EEL 5820.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Real Time Comp and App
data.description: Introduction to real-time computing; real-time system modeling; classic uniprocessor scheduling; power-aware and thermal-aware real-time scheduling; multiprocessor and distributed real-time computing.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Individual Work
data.description: Special problems or projects selected by the students and a faculty member. The student conducts the project with a minimum of supervision. Consent of Department Chairperson and Faculty Advisor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Special Topics
data.description: Course covers advanced topics not in existing graduate courses in electrical and computer engineering. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Thesis
data.description: The student, following the option of the Master's Degree with thesis, should work for his/her thesis through this course. Prerequisite: Graduate standing.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Intro Electronic Warfare
data.description: N/A

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Adv Fields and Waves
data.description: N/A

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Advanced Research
data.description: Advanced research credits under the supervision of the dissertation advisor. Prerequisite: Completion of the written comprehensive examination.

data.subject: EEL
data.name: Ph.D. Dissertation
data.description: Doctoral research leading to Ph.D. Electrical Engineering Dissertation. Prerequisites: Permission of Major Professor and Doctoral Candidacy.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Ed Need Stud Except
data.description: Significant concepts in relation to the educational needs of students with exceptionalities.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Instr Prac Ese I
data.description: This course includes the theoretical basis and principles of appropriate instructional practices and techniques for students with mild disabilities, IEP planning, and curriculum development.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Teach Exc Incl Set
data.description: Focuses on the foundations of inclusive education, characteristics of students with disabilities, instructional strategies, and collaboration among educators and parents.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Speech, Lang and Literacy
data.description: This course provides knowledge of typical and atypical speech, language, and literacy development in young children. This course covers reading competencies 1 & 2.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Assmnt Stud W/Except
data.description: Basic assessment concepts and application to appropriate test selection, administration, scoring, and interpretation. Informal and formal techniques employed for purposes of gathering data for instructional planning. Prerequisite or Corequisite:  EEX 3070 or EEX 3012

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Found & Trans for IWD
data.description: Conditions that affect learning for students with moderate to severe disabilities, curriculum, transition and skills to function independently in postsecondary education. Field hours. Prerequisites and Corequisite: EEX 3012 and/or EEX 3070.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Student Teaching
data.description: Culminating internship experience for special education majors. Students will assume all responsibilities in classroom and all FEAP and ESE competencies learned in program will be demonstrated. Prerequisite: Student must be program admitted into a School of Education Initial Teacher Education Program prior to registering for this course.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Dir Stud Spec Ed
data.description: Concepts or competencies contracted between an undergraduate student and faculty member in accordance with the student's individual needs.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Teach Exc Incl Set
data.description: To develop understandings, skills and dispositions necessary to instruct students with disabilities in inclusive settings, and to collaborate with professionals and parents. 10 field hours required.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Lit Spec Education
data.description: Provides teachers with knowledge of specific developmental, remedial reading and language arts strategies, assessment and implementation models that can be used for students with exceptionalities.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Int Cur Assmt Instr
data.description: This course constitutes the culminating experience in the Masters Program by establishing the link between curriculum, assessment, and instruction. Prerequisite: Completion of required Masters course work.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Sem Sp Ed Sup Lead
data.description: Problems in school administration and pattern of curriculum organization as they relate to people with disabilities. Focus on conceptual framework, change factors and future trends in special education.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Sup Field Exp Spe Ed
data.description: Demonstration in a field site of the full range of competencies in diagnostic teaching learned throughout the program. Placements include a variety of field settings.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Dir Stud Spec Ed
data.description: Concepts or competencies contracted for by graduate students with a faculty member.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Adv Is Cld Stud Exc
data.description: The course will focus on highly effective educators, minority students in special education, critical issues such as inclusion and assessment, and teacher preparation and support in urban districts.

data.subject: EEX
data.name: Research Ed Psy/Se
