data.description: The theory and practice of designing stage costumes through play and character analysis, research, and translation of this information into effective stage costume designs.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Scenic Design I
data.description: Nontraditional approaches to the development of design elements for the stage.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Scene Painting
data.description: A hands-on study of the basic techniques and processes used by scenic artists.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Teh Theatre Lab IV
data.description: Supervised crew work. Required of Theatre majors.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Adv Tech Proj I
data.description: Advanced practical projects in theatre design and technology in support of produced departmental productions. Projects are assigned to the student on the basis of emphasis and experience. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Adv Tech Proj II
data.description: Advanced practical projects in theatre design and technology in support of produced departmental productions. Projects are assigned to the student on the basis of emphasis and experience. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Adv Tech Proj III
data.description: Advanced practical projects in theatre design and technology in support of produced departmental productions. Projects are assigned to the student on the basis of emphasis and experience. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: TPA
data.name: Portfolio I
data.description: Supervised individual investigation of special research projects in design and technology. Projects are designed to enhance the student's portfolio. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Intro To Acting
data.description: An introduction to the acting process. Self awareness, physical and vocal control, basic stage techniques and beginning scene work will be studied. Intended for the student with little or no acting experience.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Acting II
data.description: Stanislavsky techniques with an emphasis on making actable choices through rehearsal and text analysis. Scene work using the plays of Anton Chekhov. Majors only.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Theatre Voice Mov I
data.description: Development of the actors voice and body for the demands of clear performance.  An exploration of proper vocal production and movement fundamentals.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Acting IV
data.description: Continuation of the development and training of acting skills with emphasis on transformational character choices. Scene work in modern styles from playwrights such as O'Neill, Williams, Fornes, and Lorca. Majors only.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Th Voc & Mvt IV
data.description: Exploration of physical and vocal approaches to heightened texts and verse. Emphasis on the 2nd part of the Linklater Voice Progression, scansion, rhetorical structures and clear speech.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Intro Acting/Directing TV/Film
data.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of acting/directing for TV/Film through practical exercise and creative assignments.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Directing I
data.description: Basic principles of play direction; including problems of selecting, analyzing, casting, and rehearsing plays, script analysis.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Dialects
data.description: A study of dialects common to western theatre.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Acting VI
data.description: A comprehensive course in the study of acting, writing and directing for the camera-documentary, dramatic scenes, commercials - offered in conjunction with Channel 17.  BFA majors only.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Ud Production/Perf
data.description: Exploration of the acting process through rehearsal and performance of a play. Class must be repeated 3 times for 3 credits. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor.

data.subject: TPP
data.name: Acting VIII
data.description: Survey of techniques used in solo performance and one-actor productions, featuring practical application of these techniques to original materials.  BFA majors only.

data.subject: TRA
data.name: Princ Transport
data.description: Overview of transportation systems. Topics include: a survey of transportation modes (including rail, motor, water, air, and pipelines), management issues (market entry, pricing, competitive responses, service levels, capital structure, traffic management) and global perspectives.

data.subject: TRA
data.name: Logistics Tech
data.description: The use of information technology in logistics: EDI, data bases, Internet, decision support systems for logistics, and commercial logistics software. The application of quantitative models in logistics.

data.subject: TRA
data.name: Princ Logistics
data.description: Overview of the logistics functions within a firm and in the context of integrated vertical systems. Topics include: customer service, information flow, inventory control, materials management, order processing, packaging, physical distribution, purchasing, transportation, warehousing, and supply chain management.

data.subject: TRA
data.name: Logistics Strat
data.description: Study of logistics policy and strategy, computer simulation of logistics systems under various market conditions, and integration of the logistics function with marketing, production, and finance functions. Case and simulation exercises to illustrate logistics.

data.subject: TRA
data.name: Global Logistics
data.description: Logistics activities of multinational firms, international transportation systems, global sourcing, customer service, faculty location, inventory management, customs issues, export-import activities and the role of governments.

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Esol Prin/Prac I
data.description: Introduces issues, principles and practices of TESOL to develop cultural underpinnings that form foundation necessary to meet needs of linguistically diverse students.

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Esol Issues II
data.description: Provides understandings, skills, and dispositions needed to select, evaluate, and apply TESOL strategies in elementary classrooms. Prerequisite: TSL 3080

data.subject: TSL
data.name: ESOL Content Areas
data.description: Analysis, application and adaptation of ESOL methods and materials to enhance instruction for linguistically and culturally diverse students. Fulfills META requirements

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Curr Dev Esl
data.description: Description, analysis, planning, design, and evaluation of curriculum in English as a second language (K-adult).

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Love and Language
data.description: This class explores the relationship between language and emotion, and investigates how this relationship and the field of peace linguistics can inform pedagogy in the language classroom

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Tesol Sec Teachers
data.description: Analysis, application and adaptation of ESOL methods to enhance instruction for linguistically and culturally diverse students. Emphasis on secondary level learners. Fulfills META requirements.

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Prin Of Esol Testing
data.description: Advanced study and research on current issues in the field of ESOL testing. Topics include principles and practices of ESOL testing for classroom use, communicative language test development, criteria for evaluating testing instruments, and study of standardized ESOL tests.

data.subject: TSL
data.name: Field Component
data.description: Provides opportunity to carry out a variety of projects designed to develop critical reflection about teaching beliefs and practices in an ESOL classroom environment. Prerequisites: Admission to MS/TESOL program and completion of required course work.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Transp Traffic Engr
data.description: Transportation characteristics; transportation planning, traffic control devices, intersection design, network design, research.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Traffic Engineering
data.description: Speed and volume studies, traffic operations and characteristics, traffic flow theory, accident characteristics.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Highway Geom Design
data.description: Parameters governing geometric design of highways; curve superelevation, widening of highway curves, intersection design; highway interchanges, use of AASHTO design guidelines.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Adv Hwy Cap Analys
data.description: Parameters involved in calculating highway capacity and level of service on different highway and transportation facilities. Computer application will be also discussed. Prerequisite: TTE 4201.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Intel Transp System
data.description: ITS functional areas, planning architecture, standards, and evaluation. Implementation of selected ITS technologies and strategies.

data.subject: TTE
data.name: Adv Geo Design Hwy
data.description: Parameters governing the geometric design of highways; curve super-elevation; widening on highway curves; elements of intersection design; design of interchanges; use of AASHO design guidelines. Design project required. Prerequisites: SUR 3101C and TTE 4201.

data.subject: URS
data.name: Contemp Mang Issue
data.description: A proseminar on workplace issues such as AIDS, the Americans with Disability act, and  'the Glass Ceiling'. Special emphasis on diversity and increased utilization of contractual employees. Prerequisites: Ph.D. status or permission of the instructor.

data.subject: URS
data.name: Super Readings
data.description: Extensive reading and review in area of concentration taken in preparation for comprehensive examinations; supervised by Chair of Program Advisory Committee, may be repeated for credit. Corequisite: URS 7156.

data.subject: VIC
data.name: Vis Design Global Media
data.description: The course explores the relationship between images and messages in global media and the primary role that visual design plays in globalized media presentations.

data.subject: VIC
data.name: News Visualization
data.description: The course is designed to teach journalism students how to tell a story using the visual toolset to get a story right on multiple platforms, including television, radio and online. Prerequisite: MMC3003, MMC3123, RTV3531, JOU3003, JOU3117, 2.85 cumulative GPA

data.subject: VIC
data.name: WEBDESDATA
data.description: Students will learn how to design, build and publish a news website and a page on social media platforms. This course will also develop the student's skills on data journalism and data visualization.

data.subject: WOH
data.name: World Civilization
data.description: Examines key developments of major world civilizations in a comparative perspective.

data.subject: WOH
data.name: World History since 1500
data.description: The historical development of world civilizations since 1500 including historical processes and developments in social, cultural, political, and economic contexts.

data.subject: WOH
data.name: British Empire
data.description: Examines the entire history of the British Empire, and explores classical theories on the motivations and goals behind imperial expansion.

data.subject: WOH
data.name: World Hist Topics
data.description: An examination of specific themes in World History. Topics will vary with a change in theme, the course may be repeated.

data.subject: WOH
data.name: Rsch World Hist II
data.description: Semester two of a two-semester research seminar investigating topics in World history. Topics may vary.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Campus Sexual Assault
data.description: Analysis of individual and systemic antecedents and prevention strategies that relate to sexual assault in a college environment.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Intro Global Gender
data.description: Introduction to gender issues, in their intersection with issues of race, class, and ethnicity in global perspective. The focus will be on the diverse experiences of gender across the globe.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Sex Trafficking Solutions
data.description: This course will provide an overview of all forms of sex trafficking and examine the issue through a historical, theoretical and social justice lens focusing on creating solutions.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Global Women's Writing
data.description: Provides a critical introduction to global women's writing, examining the literary representation of gendered experiences of societies and cultures across the globe.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Intro to LGBTQ+ Studies
data.description: This is a global learning foundations course which will introduce you to the study of non-normative sexualities around the world.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Gender Violence & Law
data.description:
Critical analysis of power dynamics generating gender violence across gender, race,
and class globally. Focus will be on existing legal framework locally and internationally to address these crimes.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Gender and Migration
data.description: Based on feminist migration studies, this course offers a critical intersectional analysis of how women and gendered minorities experience migratory movements across the globe.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Queer Cinema
data.description: Survey of twentieth and twenty first century Queer Cinema, covering issues of gender and sexuality identity politics in Hollywood cinema from the 1920s to present.

data.subject: WST
data.name: Women Studies Intern
data.description: Supervised work experience in organization agency or business focused on women and/or girls. Prerequisites: WST 3015 or WST 3641

data.subject: WST
data.name: Gender Violence & Law
data.description: Advanced examination of power dynamics fueling gender violence across gender, race, and class globally. Focus is on existing international legal framework to apply to global case studies.

data.subject: XDP
data.name: PH.D. Student Exch.UM
data.description: N/A

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Human Anatomy
data.description: Survey of organ systems of the human body with major emphasis on the skeletal, muscular, and peripheral nervous system. Guided examination of prosected human cadavers.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Human Anatomy Demo
data.description: Survey of organ systems of the human body with major emphasis on the skeletal, muscular, and peripheral nervous system. Guided examination of prosected human cadavers.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Histology
data.description: Microscopic anatomy of cells, tissues and organs. Prerequisites:  BSC2010, CHM2210, CHM2211 Corequisite: ZOO 3753L or Instructor permission

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Histology Lab
data.description: Microscopic anatomy of cells, tissues and organs.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Gen Parasitology
data.description: Modern concepts of biology, development, immunology and pathology of animal parasites.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Gen Parasitology Lab
data.description: Modern concepts of biology, development, immunology and pathology of animal parasites.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Fish Biology
data.description: Covers the systematics, anatomy, physiology, reproductive biology, and ecology of fish.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Herpetology
data.description: Study of the biology of reptiles and amphibians with emphasis on the natural history and ecology of local species.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Primate Biology
data.description: Survey of the natural history of the prosimians, monkeys, and apes with special emphasis on primate anatomy, evolution, ecology, and behavior.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Animal Behavior
data.description: Evolutionary approach to under-standing the diversity of behavioral strategies. Ecological and physiological mechanisms of behavior will be emphasized.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Animal Behavior Lab
data.description: Evolutionary approach to under-standing the diversity of behavioral strategies. Ecological and physiological mechanisms of behavior will be emphasized.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Survey Regional Anat
data.description: The regional anatomy of the human body as revealed by dissections, radiographs, models and videos.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Neuroscience
data.description: Structure and function of the human nervous system. Dissection and demonstration of human nervous system and various neurophysiology labs.

data.subject: ZOO
data.name: Sensory Sytm Neurobiology
